body:
This appears to be [a bug in gedit](https://askubuntu.com/questions/13843/gedit-sshfs-wont-save-vi-saves-fine).

I tried the `--default-permissions` work-around on the mount, but it didn't seem to help :-(

Enabling Gedit's preference "Create a copy of file before saving"  worked for me.
Also I do not see a problem with either LibreOffice Writer or with wine's notepad.

However, I have a similar bug with Geany which tries to rename a temporary file when saving.

I could work that around too by going to Preferences-Various and disabling default setting "use_gio_unsafe_file_saving"

Here is the error and log that I got with Geany's default saving preferences :
(Which according to https://wiki.geany.org/config/all_you_never_wanted_to_know_about_file_saving is the behavior provided by GIO library and should "attempts to determine if rename is available on the underlying file system, and uses the non-atomic method if rename fails." ; apparently that does not work here) : 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1377479/37316951-655d5794-26a5-11e8-894f-8a761a800b2a.png)

````

2018/03/13 10:03:49 DEBUG : /: >Lookup: node=<nil>, err=no such file or directory
````
It looks like the issue I have with radarr and nextcloud: [https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2079](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2079)

I can see from the a strace that geany does try to rename an open file

```
lstat("/home/ncw/mnt/tmp/hello", {st_mode=S_IFREG|0664, st_size=7, ...}) = 0
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/home/ncw/mnt/tmp/hello", O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_EXCL, 0666) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/home/ncw/mnt/tmp/hello", O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_NOFOLLOW, 0666) = 13
fstat(13, {st_mode=S_IFREG|0664, st_size=0, ...}) = 0
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/home/ncw/mnt/tmp/.goutputstream-OFMYFZ", O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_EXCL, 0666) = 14
fchown(14, 502, 502)                    = 0
fchmod(14, 0100664)                     = 0
close(13)                               = 0
write(14, "Hello\npOTATO\n\n", 14)      = 14
fsync(14)                               = 0
rename("/home/ncw/mnt/tmp/.goutputstream-OFMYFZ", "/home/ncw/mnt/tmp/hello") = -1 EPERM (Operation not permitted)
close(14)                               = 0
unlink("/home/ncw/mnt/tmp/.goutputstream-OFMYFZ") = 0
```

It might be that rclone needs to support that to be perfectly compatible...

issue.title: Radarr unable to postprocess on rclone mount

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.39-155-g62e72801β
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.9.3

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux (Debian)

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
Postprocessing of Radarr

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
see link at the end of the description

Hi,

at the end of each post processing in Radarr, the movie will be moved to the final destination. In my case, it's the rclone mount.

While moving the file, a temporarily file named movie.mkv.partial is written. But after some time, the file suddenly just disappears. A time later a new partial file gets written.

The steps above are repeated over and over again. So it's like an infinite loop.

see logs on pastebin: [https://pastebin.com/duCEjerf](https://pastebin.com/duCEjerf)

issue.title: rclone mount and s3ql: Dir.Rename error: file does not exist

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Using an s3ql filesystem on top of an rclone mount (Google Drive with Cache) does not work.

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
```
rclone v1.40-116-gbe8bd896β
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1
```
#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone mount --config /root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf --allow-other --allow-non-empty --buffer-size 100M --cache-info-age 48h --cache-db-purge --cache-writes --timeout 5s --contimeout 5s --log-file /var/log/ncdrive.log --log-level INFO --daemon ncCache: /mnt/nc_drive`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2018/04/24 23:36:46 INFO  : ncCache: Cache DB path: /root/.cache/rclone/cache-backend/ncCache.db
2018/04/24 23:36:46 INFO  : ncCache: Cache chunk path: /root/.cache/rclone/cache-backend/ncCache
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Memory: true
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Size: 10M
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Total Size: 1G
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Clean Interval: 1m0s
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Workers: 4
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: File Age: 48h0m0s
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Cache Writes: enabled
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : Cache remote ncCache:: Modify window is 1ms
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Cache DB path: /root/.cache/rclone/cache-backend/ncCache.db
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Cache chunk path: /root/.cache/rclone/cache-backend/ncCache
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Memory: true
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Size: 10M
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Total Size: 1G
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Chunk Clean Interval: 1m0s
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Workers: 4
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: File Age: 48h0m0s
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : ncCache: Cache Writes: enabled
2018/04/24 23:36:47 INFO  : Cache remote ncCache:: Modify window is 1ms
2018/04/24 23:37:08 ERROR : s3ql_passphrase#13456-140217174279936.tmp: Dir.Rename error: file does not exist
2018/04/24 23:37:10 INFO  : : put: cache expired
2018/04/24 23:37:10 INFO  : s3ql_passphrase#13456-140217174279936.tmp: Copied (new)
2018/04/24 23:37:48 INFO  : : received cache expiry notification
2018/04/24 23:37:48 INFO  : s3ql_passphrase#13456-140217174279936.tmp: received cache expiry notification
```

mkfs.s3ql fails:
```
root@webserver ~ # mkfs.s3ql local:///mnt/nc_drive/
Before using S3QL, make sure to read the user's guide, especially
the 'Important Rules to Avoid Loosing Data' section.
Enter encryption password: 
Confirm encryption password: 
Generating random encryption key...
ERROR: Uncaught top-level exception:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/mkfs.s3ql", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('s3ql==2.26', 'console_scripts', 'mkfs.s3ql')()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/s3ql-2.26-py3.5-linux-x86_64.egg/s3ql/mkfs.py", line 131, in main
    backend['s3ql_passphrase'] = data_pw
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/s3ql-2.26-py3.5-linux-x86_64.egg/s3ql/backends/common.py", line 265, in __setitem__
    self.store(key, value)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/s3ql-2.26-py3.5-linux-x86_64.egg/s3ql/backends/common.py", line 368, in store
    self.perform_write(lambda fh: fh.write(val), key, metadata)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/s3ql-2.26-py3.5-linux-x86_64.egg/s3ql/backends/common.py", line 108, in wrapped
    return method(*a, **kw)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/s3ql-2.26-py3.5-linux-x86_64.egg/s3ql/backends/common.py", line 339, in perform_write
    with self.open_write(key, metadata, is_compressed) as fh:
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/s3ql-2.26-py3.5-linux-x86_64.egg/s3ql/backends/comprenc.py", line 228, in open_write
    fh = self.backend.open_write(key, meta_raw)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/s3ql-2.26-py3.5-linux-x86_64.egg/s3ql/backends/local.py", line 103, in open_write
    os.rename(tmpname, path)
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/mnt/nc_drive/s3ql_passphrase#13456-140217174279936.tmp' -> '/mnt/nc_drive/s3ql_passphrase'
```
```
root@webserver ~ # ls -la /mnt/nc_drive/
insgesamt 0
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 0 Apr 24 23:37 s3ql_passphrase#13456-140217174279936.tmp
```
The same happens when not using the cache backend, but Google Drive directly.
```
2018/04/24 23:41:08 ERROR : s3ql_passphrase#13745-139705347577600.tmp: Dir.Rename error: file does not exist
2018/04/24 23:41:10 INFO  : s3ql_passphrase#13745-139705347577600.tmp: Copied (new)
```
```
root@webserver ~ # ls -la /mnt/nc_drive/
insgesamt 0
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 0 Apr 24 23:41 s3ql_passphrase#13745-139705347577600.tmp
```

body: I have the same problem and it works just fine with an other text editor

Sorry, I should have been more specific! 
I'm using rclone-browser so I don't mount anything directly. 

After a quick look into the rclone-browser sources, I don't think this argument is used when mounting so in my case, it does not seems to be an issue related to the rclone project... 

But in a rclone-browser mounted directory, using an other text editor than gedit, it works fine...

> Sorry, I should have been more specific!
> I'm using rclone-browser so I don't mount anything directly.
> 
> After a quick look into the rclone-browser sources, I don't think this argument is used when mounting so in my case, it does not seems to be an issue related to the rclone project...
> 
> But in a rclone-browser mounted directory, using an other text editor than gedit, it works fine...

Text editors do different things when saving files.  Some save to a new file then rename it over the old one.  Some so that but leave the file open while renaming.  `--vfs-cache-mode writes` should cure that hopefull!
